title: Two Indians Make It To Fortune's Most Influential 'Under 40' List & We Couldn't Be More Proud!
text:
Two Indians Make It To Fortune's Most Influential 'Under 40' List & We Couldn't Be More Proud!

Two Indians Make It To Fortune's Most Influential 'Under 40' List & We Couldn't Be More Proud!

Fortune has released its annual list of the 40 most influential and inspiring young people in business under the age of 40, and the best part about that is two Indian-origin persons have been named in that list.

Intel’s Vice President of artificial intelligence software and the Al lab Arjun Bansal and fashion platform Zilingo CEO and co-founder Ankiti Bose made it to Fortune’s 2019 list.

Arjun Bansal is 35-year-old and vice president of artificial intelligence software and research semiconductor giant intel. Bansal’s team has nearly 100 workers throughout the US, Israel and Poland. One of the key works that his company has done is developing a specialised computer chips.

Instagram/Twitter

Ankiti Bose on the other hand is 27-year-old, handling a four year old Singapore-based startup after she visited Bangkok's Chatuchak market and realising its merchants had no easy way to sell their goods online, Fortune said.

Don't Miss 33.5 K SHARES 15.6 K SHARES 11.4 K SHARES 8.2 K SHARES

"What started as an aggregator of small fashion retailers has since expanded into business-to-business offerings, such as supply-chain tools, and has tapped into Southeast Asia''s booming Internet connectivity and smartphone adoption," it said.

"Just 10 per cent of the world''s venture capital-backed startups worth USD 1 billion had a female founder as of last year. Bose...is set to join that too-exclusive club," the publication said.
description: The American magazine - Fortune has released its annual list of the 40 most influential and inspiring young people in business under the age of 40 and the best part about that is two Indian-origin persons have been named in that list. Intel’s Vice President of artificial intelligence software and the Al lab Arjun Bansal and fashion platform Zilingo CEO and co-founder Ankiti Bose made it to Fortune
